verses.verse: Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about in those <S%H1992><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> when there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that there was a certain <S%H376><s%> Levite <S%H3881><s%> staying <S%H1481><s%> in the remote <S%H3411><s%> part <S%H3411><s%> of the hill <S%H2022><s%> country <S%H2022><s%> of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> who took <S%H3947><s%> a concubine <S%H6370><s%> for himself from Bethlehem <S%H1035><s%> in Judah. <S%H3063><s%>

But his concubine <S%H6370><s%> played <S%H2181><s%> the harlot <S%H2181><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him, and she went <S%H1980><s%> away from him to her father's house <S%H1004><s%> in Bethlehem <S%H1035><s%> in Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and was there <S%H8033><s%> for a period <S%H3117><s%> of four <S%H702><s%> months. <S%H2320><s%>

Then her husband <S%H376><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> her to speak <S%H1696><s%> tenderly <S%H3820><s%> to her in order to bring <S%H7725><s%> her back, <S%H7725><s%> taking with him his servant <S%H5288><s%> and a pair <S%H6776><s%> of donkeys. <S%H2543><s%> So she brought <S%H935><s%> him into her father's house, <S%H1><s%> and when the girl's father saw <S%H1004><s%> him, he was glad <S%H7200><s%> to meet <S%H8055><s%> him.

And his father-in-law, the girl's father, detained <S%H1><s%> him; and he remained <S%H2388><s%> with him three <S%H3427><s%> days. <S%H7969><s%> So they ate <S%H3117><s%> and drank <S%H398><s%> and lodged <S%H8354><s%> there. <S%H3885><s%>

Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about on the fourth <S%H7243><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that they got <S%H7925><s%> up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and he prepared <S%H6965><s%> to go; <S%H1980><s%> and the girl's father said <S%H1><s%> to his son-in-law, "Sustain <S%H559><s%> yourself <S%H5582><s%> with a piece <S%H3820><s%> of bread, <S%H6595><s%> and afterward <S%H3899><s%> you may go. <S%H310><s%>"

So both <S%H8147><s%> of them sat <S%H3427><s%> down <S%H3427><s%> and ate <S%H398><s%> and drank <S%H8354><s%> together; <S%H9191><s%> and the girl's father said <S%H1><s%> to the man, <S%H559><s%> "Please <S%H376><s%> be willing <S%H4994><s%> to spend <S%H2974><s%> the night, <S%H3885><s%> and let your heart <S%H3885><s%> be merry. <S%H3820><s%>"

Then the man <S%H376><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%> to go, <S%H1980><s%> but his father-in-law urged <S%H6484><s%> him so that he spent <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> again. <S%H7725><s%>

And on the fifth <S%H2549><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> he arose <S%H7925><s%> to go <S%H1980><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and the girl's father said, <S%H1><s%> "Please <S%H559><s%> sustain <S%H4994><s%> yourself, <S%H5582><s%> and wait <S%H3824><s%> until <S%H4102><s%> afternoon <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5186><s%>"; so both <S%H3117><s%> of them ate. <S%H8147><s%>

When the man <S%H376><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%> to go <S%H1980><s%> along with his concubine <S%H6370><s%> and servant, <S%H5288><s%> his father-in-law, the girl's father, said <S%H1><s%> to him, "Behold <S%H559><s%> now, <S%H2009><s%> the day <S%H4994><s%> has drawn <S%H3117><s%> to a close; <S%H7503><s%> please <S%H6150><s%> spend <S%H4994><s%> the night. <S%H3885><s%> Lo, <S%H3885><s%> the day <S%H2009><s%> is coming <S%H3117><s%> to an end; <S%H2583><s%> spend <S%H2583><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> here <S%H3885><s%> that your heart <S%H6311><s%> may be merry. <S%H3824><s%> Then tomorrow <S%H3190><s%> you may arise <S%H4279><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> for your journey <S%H7925><s%> so that you may go <S%H1870><s%> home. <S%H1980><s%>"

But the man <S%H376><s%> was not willing <S%H14><s%> to spend <S%H3885><s%> the night, <S%H3885><s%> so he arose <S%H6965><s%> and departed <S%H1980><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> to [a place] opposite <S%H5227><s%> Jebus <S%H2982><s%> (that is, Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>). And there were with him a pair <S%H6776><s%> of saddled <S%H2280><s%> donkeys; <S%H2543><s%> his concubine <S%H6370><s%> also was with him.

When they [were] near <S%H5973><s%> Jebus, <S%H2982><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> was almost <S%H3966><s%> gone; <S%H7286><s%> and the servant <S%H5288><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his master, <S%H113><s%> "Please <S%H4994><s%> come, <S%H1980><s%> and let us turn <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> into this <S%H2088><s%> city <S%H5892><s%> of the Jebusites <S%H2983><s%> and spend <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> in it."

However, his master <S%H113><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, "We will not turn <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> into the city <S%H5892><s%> of foreigners <S%H5237><s%> who <S%H834><s%> are not of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel; <S%H3478><s%> but we will go <S%H5674><s%> on as far <S%H5704><s%> as Gibeah. <S%H1390><s%>"

And he said <S%H559><s%> to his servant, <S%H5288><s%> "Come <S%H1980><s%> and let us approach <S%H7126><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of these places; <S%H4725><s%> and we will spend <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%> or <S%H176><s%> Ramah. <S%H7414><s%>"

So they passed <S%H5674><s%> along <S%H5674><s%> and went <S%H1980><s%> their way, and the sun <S%H8121><s%> set <S%H935><s%> on them near <S%H681><s%> Gibeah <S%H1390><s%> which <S%H834><s%> belongs to Benjamin. <S%H1144><s%>

And they turned <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> in order to enter <S%H935><s%> [and] lodge <S%H3885><s%> in Gibeah. <S%H1390><s%> When they entered, <S%H935><s%> they sat <S%H3427><s%> down <S%H3427><s%> in the open <S%H7339><s%> square <S%H7339><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> for no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H376><s%> took <S%H622><s%> them into [his] house <S%H1004><s%> to spend <S%H3885><s%> the night. <S%H3885><s%>

Then behold, <S%H2009><s%> an old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> was coming <S%H935><s%> out of the field <S%H7704><s%> from his work <S%H4639><s%> at evening. <S%H6153><s%> Now the man <S%H376><s%> was from the hill <S%H2022><s%> country <S%H2022><s%> of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> and he was staying <S%H1481><s%> in Gibeah, <S%H1390><s%> but the men <S%H376><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> were Benjamites. <S%H1145><s%>

And he lifted <S%H5375><s%> up his eyes <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> the traveler <S%H376><s%> <S%H732><s%> in the open <S%H7339><s%> square <S%H7339><s%> of the city; <S%H5892><s%> and the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Where <S%H575><s%> are you going, <S%H1980><s%> and where <S%H370><s%> do you come <S%H935><s%> from?"

And he said <S%H559><s%> to him, "We are passing <S%H5674><s%> from Bethlehem <S%H1035><s%> in Judah <S%H3063><s%> to the remote <S%H3411><s%> part <S%H3411><s%> of the hill <S%H2022><s%> country <S%H2022><s%> of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> [for] I am from there, <S%H8033><s%> and I went <S%H1980><s%> to Bethlehem <S%H1035><s%> in Judah. <S%H3063><s%> But I am [now] going <S%H1980><s%> to my house, <S%H1004><s%> and no <S%H369><s%> man <S%H376><s%> will take <S%H622><s%> me into his house. <S%H1004><s%>

"Yet there <S%H3426><s%> is both <S%H1571><s%> straw <S%H8401><s%> and fodder <S%H4554><s%> for our donkeys, <S%H2543><s%> and also <S%H1571><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> for me, your maidservant, <S%H519><s%> and the young <S%H5288><s%> man <S%H5288><s%> who is with your servants; <S%H5650><s%> there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> lack <S%H4270><s%> of anything. <S%H3605><s%> <S%H1697><s%>"

And the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Peace <S%H7965><s%> to you. Only <S%H7534><s%> let me [take care of] all <S%H3605><s%> your needs; <S%H4270><s%> however, <S%H7534><s%> do not spend <S%H3885><s%> the night <S%H3885><s%> in the open <S%H7339><s%> square. <S%H7339><s%>"

So he took <S%H935><s%> him into his house <S%H1004><s%> and gave <S%H9054><s%> the donkeys <S%H2543><s%> fodder, <S%H9054><s%> and they washed <S%H7364><s%> their feet <S%H7272><s%> and ate <S%H398><s%> and drank. <S%H8354><s%>

While they were making <S%H3190><s%> <S%H3820><s%> merry, <S%H3190><s%> <S%H3820><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> certain <S%H376><s%> worthless <S%H1100><s%> fellows, <S%H1121><s%> surrounded <S%H5437><s%> the house, <S%H1004><s%> pounding <S%H1849><s%> the door; <S%H1817><s%> and they spoke <S%H559><s%> to the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> the old <S%H2205><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Bring <S%H3318><s%> out the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> came <S%H935><s%> into your house <S%H1004><s%> that we may have <S%H3045><s%> relations <S%H3045><s%> with him."

Then the man, <S%H376><s%> the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> out to them and said <S%H559><s%> to them, "No, <S%H408><s%> my fellows, <S%H251><s%> please <S%H4994><s%> do not act <S%H7489><s%> so wickedly; <S%H7489><s%> since <S%H310><s%> <S%H834><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> man <S%H376><s%> has come <S%H935><s%> into my house, <S%H1004><s%> do not commit <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> act <S%H5039><s%> of folly. <S%H5039><s%>

"Here <S%H2009><s%> is my virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> and his concubine. <S%H6370><s%> Please <S%H4994><s%> let me bring <S%H3318><s%> them out that you may ravish <S%H6031><s%> them and do <S%H6213><s%> to them whatever you wish. <S%H2896><s%> <S%H5869><s%> But do not commit <S%H6213><s%> such <S%H2088><s%> an act <S%H1697><s%> of folly <S%H5039><s%> against this <S%H2088><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>"

But the men <S%H376><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not listen <S%H8085><s%> to him, so the man <S%H376><s%> seized <S%H2388><s%> his concubine <S%H6370><s%> and brought <S%H3318><s%> [her] out to them. And they raped <S%H3045><s%> her and abused <S%H9412><s%> her all <S%H3605><s%> night <S%H3915><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> morning, <S%H1242><s%> then let <S%H7971><s%> her go <S%H7971><s%> at the approach <S%H5927><s%> of dawn. <S%H7837><s%>

As the day <S%H1242><s%> began to dawn, <S%H6437><s%> <S%H1242><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and fell <S%H5307><s%> down <S%H5307><s%> at the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of the man's house <S%H1004><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> her master <S%H113><s%> was, until <S%H5704><s%> [full] daylight. <S%H216><s%>

When her master <S%H113><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> and opened <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> and went <S%H3318><s%> out to go <S%H1980><s%> on his way, <S%H1870><s%> then behold, <S%H2009><s%> his concubine <S%H6370><s%> was lying <S%H5307><s%> at the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%> with her hands <S%H3027><s%> on the threshold. <S%H5592><s%>

And he said <S%H559><s%> to her, "Get <S%H6965><s%> up and let us go, <S%H1980><s%>" but there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> answer. <S%H6030><s%> Then he placed <S%H3947><s%> her on the donkey; <S%H2543><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H1980><s%> to his home. <S%H4725><s%>

When he entered <S%H935><s%> his house, <S%H1004><s%> he took <S%H3947><s%> a knife <S%H3979><s%> and laid <S%H2388><s%> hold <S%H2388><s%> of his concubine <S%H6370><s%> and cut <S%H5408><s%> her in twelve <S%H8147><s%> <S%H6240><s%> pieces, <S%H5409><s%> limb by limb, <S%H6106><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> her throughout <S%H3605><s%> the territory <S%H1366><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

And it came <S%H1961><s%> about that all <S%H3605><s%> who saw <S%H7200><s%> [it] said, <S%H559><s%> "Nothing <S%H3808><s%> like this <S%H2088><s%> has [ever] happened <S%H1961><s%> or been seen <S%H7200><s%> from the day <S%H3117><s%> when the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came <S%H5927><s%> up from the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to this <S%H2088><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%> Consider <S%H7760><s%> it, take <S%H5779><s%> counsel <S%H5779><s%> and speak <S%H1696><s%> up!"
